info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BERRIEN COUNTY THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1018 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Michigan near Lake Michigan Beach, or 7 miles north of Benton Harbor, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This includes the following highways... Interstate 196 between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 94 in Michigan between mile markers 30 and 42. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
